text: Higgs boson is not for the faint of
heart this is tough stuff even for
physicists the first thing you have to
know about the higgs boson is how it's
usually referred to is that it's kind of
a cosmic MacGuffin the MacGuffin is
alfred hitchcock's term for a plot
device that kind of starts the plot
moving but really isn't that important
it doesn't do anything except it's
evidence for something else something
called the Higgs field which is a very
important player in cosmic evolution the
Higgs field is a kind of a notion that
we live in an energy ocean and it fills
space so we can't feel it it's we're
sort of like fishing in a bowl I think
the fact that Peter Higgs and Francois
Englert got the Nobel Prize today means
that the vast community of scientists
and physicists have accepted that this
is true that this field of energy is not
a creation of JK Rowling it is a real
part of our universe and something that
we have to take into account when we
think about who we are and where we came
from and where we're going
you
